alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Madison; Oconee; Oglethorpe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 7:27AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms with very heavy rain will impact portions of southeastern Oconee, eastern Clarke, Oglethorpe and southeastern Madison Counties through 830 AM EST... At 726 AM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms with extremely heavy rain was along a line extending from Carlton to Barnett Shoals, and moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Heavy rain may cause minor flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Be prepared to take action if a Flood Warning is issued. Locations impacted include... Lexington, Comer, Winterville, Crawford, Colbert, Arnoldsville, Carlton, Hull, Whitehall, Athens-Clarke County, Diamond Hill, Smithonia, Hutchings, Barnett Shoals, Paoli, Dunlap, Watson Mill Bridge State Park, Vesta and Point Peter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. Electrical appliances should not be used unless in an emergency. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon EST for east central Georgia.
